frame.name: Part_inner_outer
frame.definition:
<def-root>This frame concerns <fen>Part</fen>s of objects that are defined relative to the center or edge of the object. The <fen>Part</fen> is a part of the <fen>Whole</fen> and the <fen>Part_prop</fen> describes a property of the <fen>Part</fen>.
<ex>She discarded the <t><fex name="Part">exterior</fex></t> <fex name="Whole">of the walnut</fex>.</ex> <ex> She preferred a sparse <fex name="Whole">church</fex> <t><fex name="Part">interior</fex></t> . </ex>
In cases where the <t>Target</t> is an adjective, it has a special relationship with the noun that it modifies such that a phrase which is a syntactic argument of the noun is semantically available to fill the argument structure of the adjective, as in "the <t>outside</t> <fex name="Part">row</fex> <fex name="Whole">of the class</fex>"<ex>The <t>inner</t> <fex name="Part">shelf</fex> <fex name="Whole">of the bookcase</fex> was lying on the floor.</ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Part
FE.definition: <def-root>This element describes the <fen>Part</fen> of the larger <fen>Whole</fen>.<ex>She only ate the <fex name="Part"><t>skin</t></fex> <fex name="Whole">of the apple</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Whole
FE.definition: <def-root>An undivided entity having all its <fen>Part</fen>s.<ex>She eats only the <fex name="Part_Prop">thick</fex> <t><fex name="Part">skin</fex></t> <fex name="Whole">of the banana</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Part_prop
FE.definition: <def-root>A property relating to the <fen>Part</fen> of a <fen>Whole</fen>.<ex>Sue ate the <fex name="Part_prop">thick</fex> <t><fex name="Part">shell</fex></t> <fex name="Whole">of the pistachio</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: outside.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: situated on or near the outside.

lexUnit.name: inside.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: situated on or in, or derived from, the inside.

lexUnit.name: exterior.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: forming, situated on, or relating to the outside.

lexUnit.name: inner.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: situated inside; close to the centre.

lexUnit.name: outside.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the external side or surface of something.

lexUnit.name: skin.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the peel or outer layer of a fruit or vegetable or a thin outermost layer

lexUnit.name: lining.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a layer of different material covering or attached to the inside of something

lexUnit.name: perimeter.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the outermost parts or boundary of an area or object

lexUnit.name: center.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a point in the middle of something that is equally distant from all of its sides, ends, or surfaces

lexUnit.name: exterior.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the outer surface or structure of something.

lexUnit.name: inside.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the inner side or surface of a thing

lexUnit.name: interior.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the interior part of something

lexUnit.name: interior.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: situated within or inside; inner.

lexUnit.name: middle.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a middle point or position.

lexUnit.name: shell.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the hard protective outer case of a mollusc or crustacean, turtle, egg, seed, kernel, etc.

lexUnit.name: surface.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the outside part or uppermost layer of something.

lexUnit.name: central.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: of or on a position near a point equidistant to the edges of a spatial entity
